title: Tom Brady ‘was supposed’ to play for Raiders upon leaving Patriots, Las Vegas owner Mark Davis said
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady nearly joined the Las Vegas Raiders in 2020 before signing with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers as a free agent.
Mark Davis revealed the Raiders' interest in Brady was halted by their then-head coach and general manager's decision.
Brady became a minority owner of the Raiders in May 2023, following his retirement from the NFL in February.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Friendship' starring Tim Robinson and Paul Rudd is available on HBO Max.
Spike Lee's 'Highest 2 Lowest', featuring Denzel Washington, is now streaming on Apple TV+.
'The Paper', a sitcom by Greg Daniels, can be watched on Peacock.

title: What Jakobi Meyers and the Raiders are saying about the Patriots ahead of season opener
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers returns to Foxborough as a Raider for the season opener against the Patriots, with whom he previously played.
Former Patriots coach Pete Carroll now leads the Raiders, while Mike Vrabel starts his tenure as New England's head coach.
Raiders and Patriots discuss the matchup, focusing on the Patriots' strong front seven and QB Drake Maye's running ability.

title: Jaylen Brown gives his own take on Boston Tea Party in stream with IShowSpeed
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown and IShowSpeed streamed a tour of Boston, including a visit to a Boston Tea Party ship.
Brown playfully reenacted the Boston Tea Party by shooting tea buckets into the water like basketballs.
Brown lost a race to IShowSpeed in Downtown Crossing but later contested the result online.

title: Dante Scarnecchia likes what he sees from Patriots rookie Will Campbell
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots rookie tackle Will Campbell is expected to debut against the Raiders, despite a nagging ankle injury.
Coach Dante Scarnecchia praises Campbell's motor, blocking skills, and competitiveness during preseason and training camp.
Campbell was the only tackle rated over 80 in both pass and run blocking by Pro Football Focus in preseason.

title: ‘That’s their prerogative’: Mike Vrabel responds to Bill Belichick’s ban on Patriots scouts at UNC
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Bill Belichick, now coaching UNC, banned Patriots scouts from attending the university's football practices or games.
Mike Vrabel plans alternative scouting methods for UNC players, respecting Belichick's decision as a prerogative.
Belichick's first UNC game ended in a 48-14 loss against TCU, marking a rough start for his college coaching career.

title: Woman who was allegedly filmed in the shower at URI is suing the school
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A University of Rhode Island student is suing the school for negligence after allegedly being filmed in a unisex shower.
The lawsuit claims URI's lack of security in dorm restrooms creates unreasonable risks and led to defamation after the incident.
The accused man, James Paquette, was identified by the woman and faces a state-level charge of video voyeurism.

title: Christian Gonzalez to miss Patriots’ season opener, Will Campbell questionable vs. Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Christian Gonzalez will miss Patriots' season opener against the Raiders due to a hamstring injury.
Rookie left tackle Will Campbell is questionable for the Patriots with an ankle injury.
Cornerback Charles Woods and wide receiver Efton Chism III were full participants in Friday's practice.

title: Jayson Tatum’s Celtics teammate has a positive update on star’s recovery from Achilles tear
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Celtics' Jayson Tatum is progressing well in his recovery from an Achilles tear, says teammate Jordan Walsh.
No definitive timetable for Tatum's return; he has been without a boot on his foot for over a month.
Celtics' roster is adjusting with young players vying for roles amid offseason trades and Tatum's uncertain return.

title: 5 things to know about the Raiders ahead of Sunday’s matchup against the Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Pete Carroll and Geno Smith lead the Raiders into a new era, beginning with a matchup against the Patriots.
Raiders feature standout rookie tight end Brock Bowers, who set records with 1,194 receiving yards and 112 receptions last season.
The last Raiders victory in Foxborough was in 1994; they face a Patriots team now coached by Mike Vrabel.
